description.narrative: The Second Post Primary Education Projects (PEPP2) development objective is to support the GoBF strategy to increase the number and quality of students graduating from secondary school at reduced costs for parents, with increased equity of access by gender and by area (rural-urban).

condition.narrative: The Recipient has adopted a Project Implementation Manual in form and substance satisfactory to the Association
The Recipient has developed a computerized information system for the financial management of the Project (including the softwarecustomization, the adoption of the Manual of Financial, Administrative
The Recipient has opened a Designated Account in CFA Francs in the BCEAO on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Association,for the disbursement of the proceeds of the Financing.
The Recipient has recruited an external financial auditor for the Project under terms and conditions acceptable to the Association

title.narrative: Students' learning performance in Math, Science, and French is increased by 2% point average, measured through standardized testingmethods.

comment.narrative: Learning assessment conducted and 2007 results are available

title.narrative: Quality of tertiary education is improved through construction and equipment of 3 distance learning centers in Ouaga, Bobo, and Koudougou.
Secondary VET training is increased through construction of 2 VET CEGs.

comment.narrative: Given the time remaining for the project closing, The ministry has decided to upgrade curriculum and equipment in 5 areas and isona process of finalizing procurement processing.

title.narrative: GER in secondary education increases from 15.5% in 2004 to 25% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 27.4% based on previous census.

title.narrative: GER of girls in lower secondary rises from 17.2% in 2004 to 28% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 33.4% based on previous census.

title.narrative: GER in lower secondary education increases from 20% in 2004 to 33% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 36.9% based on previous census.

title.narrative: Gross intake rate in first grade of lower secondary rises from 22% in 2004 to 40% in 2009.

comment.narrative: End target indicator updated during restructuration

The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. Base on previous census data, the indicator would be 37,7%.

title.narrative: Repetition rate in secondary education is reduced:- Lower secondary (6#me, 5#me, 4#me) from 25% in 2004 to 16% in 2009. - Uppersecondary (2nde et 1#re) from 18% in 2004 to 11% in 2009.
Share of MESSRS in the education budget is increased from 28% in 2004 to 40% in 2009.
Share of secondary education in MESSRS budget is increased from 31% in 2005 to 50% in 2009.
Elaboration of new curriculum of lower secondary education is finalized in five subject matters.
School fees supported by families in public lower secondary schools in the 18 low-covered provinces reduced to 10,000 F.CFA/year per student.
Teachers' performance is improved through in- and pre-service training and a better pedagogic monitoring. (At least one inspector visit will be made to 80% of lower secondary teachers per year).
Completion rate at lower secondary rises from 45% in 2004 to 60% in 2009.

comment.narrative: End target indicator updated during restructuration

The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures.

title.narrative: VET training opportunities are extended to 5 new areas.
GER of girls in lower secondary education in the 18 underserved provinces increases from 5.5% in 2004 to 12% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 16.22% based on previous census.

title.narrative: Availability of textbooks in lower secondary education is increased (6-8 textbooks per student), and 2 textbooks per student provided in upper secondary education.

baseline.value: 6 at lower secondary 0.5 at high secondary

target.value: 8 at lower secondary 2 at high secondary

actual.value: 935,000 textbooks acquired for Lower Secondary. No acquisition for higher secondary

title.narrative: GER in upper secondary education increases from 8% in 2004 to 13% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 12.4% base on previous census.

title.narrative: Average Gross Enrollment rate in lower secondary in the 18 less-covered provinces rises from 8.4% in 2004 to 13% in 2009.

comment.narrative: The baseline and previous current values were calculated based on population estimates from the 1996 population census. Thesepopulation estimates were recently revised according to the 2006 population census, leading to a decrease in the current indicatordue toan increase in the absolute population figures. The indicator would be 20.6% based on previous census.

title.narrative: National policy on vocation education and training is adopted.

actual.value: The national TVET policy has been adopted by the sector and Donors.

title.narrative: MESSRS management capacity is improved through an integrated IMS.

comment.narrative: Equipment and system acquired and qualified staff hired. System partially operational

title.narrative: Students enrolled in secondary (Number of boys and girls)

comment.narrative: Lower and Upper Secondary based on 2009-2010 school year data

title.narrative: Students enrolled in vocational training (number of girls and boys)

comment.narrative: TVET Based on School year 2010-2011 data.

title.narrative: Undergraduate students enrolled in tertiary education (number)
